intro: Harpalyce acunae, commonly known as the Mexican harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Harpalyce acunae produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
